alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 07 at 2:31PM PST until December 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Above 3000 feet, snow accumulations 10 to 17 inches, with up to 22 inches possible along the peaks of the volcanoes. Between 2000 and 3000 feet, total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow accumulation will be gradual with the peak period of snow falling between 10 PM tonight through 12 PM Thursday. Lingering snow showers will persist through early Friday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
